sections.text: Section 1: The hospital never truly sleeps. At this hour, the ER hums with layered tension—machines whispering vitals, staff exchanging looks that carry whole conversations. You feel the weight of your decisions accumulating, shaping how others see you and what doors may open or close.

sections.text: Security escorts you away as the word 'malpractice' echoes in the corridor. The hospital that once relied on you now closes ranks.
Your reputation precedes you. A new hospital awaits, a promotion secured—but familiar faces are left behind, their absence louder than applause.
